ul.li1: 1The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise child makes a father glad,
ul.li2: but a foolish child grieves his mother.
ul.li1: 2Treasures of wickedness do not profit,
ul.li2: but righteousness delivers from death.
ul.li1: 3Yahweh will not cause a righteous personOr “soul,” or “inner self” to go hungry,
ul.li2: but the craving of the wicked he will thwart.
ul.li1: 4A slack hand causes poverty,
ul.li2: but the hand of the diligent enriches.
ul.li1: 5He who gathers in the summer is a child who is prudent;
ul.li2: he who sleeps at the harvest is a child who brings shame.
ul.li1: 6Blessings belong to the head of the righteous,
ul.li2: but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
ul.li1: 7The memory of righteousness is like a blessing,
ul.li2: but the name of the wicked will rot.
ul.li1: 8A heart of wisdom will heed commandments,
ul.li2: but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
ul.li1: 9Whoever walks in integrityHebrew “in the integrity” will walk securely,
ul.li2: but whoever follows perversity, his ways will be made known.
ul.li1: 10The winking of an eye causesOr “gives, sets up” trouble,
ul.li2: and the foolishness of lips comes to ruin.
ul.li1: 11A fountain of life is a mouth of righteousness,
ul.li2: and a mouth of wickedness conceals violence.
ul.li1: 12Hatred stirs up strife,
ul.li2: but love covers over all offenses.
ul.li1: 13On the lips of one who has understanding, wisdom is found,
ul.li2: but a rod is for the back of one who lacks sense.Literally “heart”
ul.li1: 14Those who are wise lay up knowledge,
ul.li2: but to the mouth of the fool, ruin draws near.
ul.li1: 15The wealth of the rich is the city of his strength;
ul.li2: the ruin of the poor is their poverty.
ul.li1: 16The wage of the righteous leads to life;
ul.li2: the gain of the wicked to sin.
ul.li1: 17On the path to life is he who guards instruction,
ul.li2: but he who rejects rebuke goes astray.
ul.li1: 18He who conceals hatred has lips of deceit,
ul.li2: and he who utters slander—he is a fool.
ul.li1: 19In many words, transgression is not lacking,
ul.li2: but he who restrains his lips is prudent.
ul.li1: 20Choice silver is a tongue of righteousness,
ul.li2: a heartOr “mind” of wickedness is of little worth.Literally “like a little”
ul.li1: 21Lips of righteousness feed many,
ul.li2: but fools die for lack of sense.Literally “in the lack of heart, they die”
ul.li1: 22The blessing of Yahweh makes one rich,
ul.li2: and he does not increase sorrow with it.
ul.li1: 23It is like a sport for a fool to do wrong,
ul.li2: wisdom for a person of understanding.
ul.li1: 24The dread of the wicked will come upon him,
ul.li2: but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
ul.li1: 25With the passing of the tempest, there is no wickedness,
ul.li2: but the righteous have a foundation forever.
ul.li1: 26Like vinegar to the tooth and like smoke to the eyes,
ul.li2: thus is the lazy to one who employsOr “sends” him.
ul.li1: 27The fear of Yahweh adds life,
ul.li2: but the years of the wicked are shortened.
ul.li1: 28The hope of the righteous is gladness,
ul.li2: but the expectation of the wicked comes to nothing.
ul.li1: 29A stronghold for the upright is the way of Yahweh,
ul.li2: but ruin belongs to evildoers.Literally “them who do evil”
ul.li1: 30The righteous one is forever; he will not be removed.
ul.li2: But the wicked will not remain in the land.Or “earth”
ul.li1: 31The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
ul.li2: but a tongue of perversity will be cut off.
ul.li1: 32The lips of the righteous know the acceptable,
ul.li2: but the mouth of the wicked, the perverse.
